intro: Palaquium poilanei, commonly known as the Pouleain palm, is a tropical plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, palm-like appearance with a short trunk and large, pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by edible fruits resembling small, round berries. Palaquium poilanei is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important species in the biodiversity of its native habitat.
